properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 9 at 11:50AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Lookout Creek near New England affecting Dade and Hamilton
Counties

Oostanaula River near Rome US Hwy. 27 affecting Floyd County

Chattahoochee River near Columbus affecting Lee...Russell...
Chattahoochee and Muscogee Counties

Ocmulgee River near Hawkinsville affecting Bleckley and Pulaski
Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Ocmulgee River near Hawkinsville.
* From late tonight until further notice.
* At 10AM Sunday the stage was 17.4 feet...and rising.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* Forecast to rise above flood stage just after midnight tomorrow morning
and continue to rise to near 26.2 feet by Wednesday morning.
* At 26.0 feet...Moderate floodings begins...with several homes
surrounded by flood waters and at least 3 homes begin flooding near
Gooseneck Lane and RiverView Road.
* This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.1 feet on Jan 25 1963.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
